jobs.title: Implementation Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Multiverse is the upskilling platform for AI and Tech adoption.

We have partnered with 1,500+ companies to deliver a new kind of learning that's transforming today’s workforce.

Our upskilling apprenticeships are designed for people of any age and career stage to build critical AI, data, and tech skills. Our learners have driven $2bn+ ROI for their employers, using the skills they’ve learned to improve productivity and measurable performance.

In June 2022, we announced a $220 million Series D funding round co-led by StepStone Group, Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst. With a post-money valuation of $1.7bn, the round makes us the UK’s first EdTech unicorn.

But we aren’t stopping there. With a strong operational footprint and 800+ employees, we have ambitious plans to continue scaling. We’re building a world where tech skills unlock people’s potential and output.

Join Multiverse and power our mission to equip the workforce to win in the AI era.

The Opportunity

We are looking for an experienced and dynamic Implementation Manager to join our Customer Success Operations Team. This role acts as an essential bridge between the various phases leading up to our “Flying Start” and learner onboarding process. The Implementation Manager will play a critical role, steering the fulfilment and onboarding process of our customers from post-sales phases through to successful client platform launch. Using structured implementation methods—such as clear onboarding processes, collaborative project management, and data-driven insights—the ideal candidate will focus on building strong relationships, meeting fulfilment targets, and ensuring clients are fully equipped to get value from our product.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with cross functional teams, including Sales, Customer Success, Admissions, and Delivery teams, to manage and implement large-scale, customised launches.

  • Develop and maintain effective launch project plans ensuring timely completion of pre-launch activities while adhering to key deadlines.

  • Oversee the fulfilment and implementation process post-B2B sales, proactively identifying and addressing any potential risks to revenue.

  • Assist infosec teams in conducting technology checks and ensure apprentices can fully access and effectively make use of our platform and necessary software.

  • Provide client support, delivering an exceptional onboarding experience and successful program launch while setting the stage for enduring success.

  • Maintain direct communication with clients, including Champion and HR teams, and Apprentice Managers to assist them in fully utilising our platform.

  • Implement feedback from both internal and external stakeholders for continuous improvement and process enhancement.

  • Identify and execute process improvement initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and improve client satisfaction.

Requirements and Skills

  • Experience: 3-4 years in client relationship management within an implementation team or similar role, demonstrating the ability to foster strong partnerships and collaboration with cross-functional teams, including sales; customer success & delivery.

  • Project management: proven track record in managing complex projects with diverse stakeholders, ensuring timely delivery and successful client outcomes.

  • Analytical skills: proficient in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from multiple sources to drive decision-making and improve processes.

  • Interpersonal skills: exceptional communication abilities, both written and verbal, essential for managing relationships with clients and internal teams.

  • Client Focus: passionate about providing exceptional client experiences by understanding their needs and aligning strategies to meet those needs.

  • Adaptability: ability to thrive in a fast-paced, changing environment, with a strong capability to adjust strategies based on emerging insights or client demands.

  • Proactive Mindset: resilient and solution-oriented, with a knack for anticipating challenges and implementing effective solutions.

At Multiverse we value innovation, collaboration, and the commitment to ensure the best outcomes for our clients and apprentices. If you share our values, possess the required skills, and are passionate about making a positive impact, we'd love to hear from you.

How we hire

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 7 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days and 4 company-wide wellbeing days and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Gympass and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - and the opportunity to take part in our work-from-anywhere scheme

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We’re an equal opportunities employer. And proud of it. Every applicant and employee is afforded the same opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. This will never change. Read our Equality, Diversity & Inclusion policy here.

Right to Work

Do you have the right to work in the UK? Unfortunately, at this time we cannot offer sponsorship for this role and we cannot consider overseas applications.

Safeguarding

All posts in Multiverse involve some degree of responsibility for safeguarding. Successful applicants are required to complete a Disclosure Form from the Disclosure and Barring Service ("DBS") for the position. Failure to declare any convictions (that are not subject to DBS filtering) may disqualify a candidate for appointment or result in summary dismissal if the discrepancy comes to light subsequently.

jobs.title: Senior Sales Enablement Manager (Product)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Multiverse is the upskilling platform for AI and Tech adoption.

We have partnered with 1,500+ companies to deliver a new kind of learning that's transforming today’s workforce.

Our upskilling apprenticeships are designed for people of any age and career stage to build critical AI, data, and tech skills. Our learners have driven $2bn+ ROI for their employers, using the skills they’ve learned to improve productivity and measurable performance.

In June 2022, we announced a $220 million Series D funding round co-led by StepStone Group, Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst. With a post-money valuation of $1.7bn, the round makes us the UK’s first EdTech unicorn.

But we aren’t stopping there. With a strong operational footprint and 800+ employees, we have ambitious plans to continue scaling. We’re building a world where tech skills unlock people’s potential and output.

Join Multiverse and power our mission to equip the workforce to win in the AI era.

Overview

As a Sales Enablement Manager on our growing GTM Enablement team, you’ll drive the implementation and delivery of strategic initiatives that enable our GTM teams across Sales and Customer Success to achieve commercial success. You’ll play a key role in onboarding, program design, learning delivery, and stakeholder collaboration—working cross-functionally with Product Marketing, RevOps, and GTM leadership to embed enablement into the flow of work.

You will be directly responsible for the onboarding and ongoing development of field teams in EMEA, with an emphasis on impact, iteration, and enablement excellence. This is a high-impact role for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments and is ready to build a best-in-class enablement experience.

Responsibilities

Enablement Program Delivery

  • Deliver comprehensive enablement programs across onboarding, ongoing learning, sales process optimization, and major GTM initiatives.

  • Own onboarding for all Customer Success segment—ensuring a consistent, high-quality ramp experience.

  • Continuously measure and improve onboarding programs, working toward reduced ramp time and increased early-stage productivity.

  • Build out scalable systems, communication flows, and playbooks for sales managers to support team coaching and development.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Partner with Product Marketing to roll out product updates, messaging, and sales collateral in an actionable, field-friendly format.

  • Collaborate with RevOps to streamline sales processes, optimize tool usage, and build consistent workflows for reps and managers.

  • Support content creation for large-scale events like Sales Kickoff (GKO), QBRs, and modular trainings.

Learning Design & Execution

  • Conceptualize and launch learning initiatives tailored to different GTM roles and segments.

  • Facilitate engaging, practical training sessions across live, async, and hybrid formats.

  • Integrate learning moments into the tools and rhythms reps already use—driving adoption without overload.

Performance Measurement & Optimization

  • Track and report the effectiveness of onboarding, learning initiatives, and enablement programs using defined KPIs.

  • Optimize usage of enablement tools (e.g., Gong, LMS, Guru and maintain the quality and accessibility of sales content.

  • Use feedback loops, field observations, and data insights to continuously improve program outcomes and rep experience.

Innovation & Culture

  • Explore creative projects that make the Enablement team more inclusive, innovative, and impactful.

  • Champion a culture of continuous learning, coaching, and field empowerment across the commercial org.

Success Metrics

Within the First 3–6 Months:

  • Launch revamped onboarding program across at least two segments (e.g., BDRs and AEs).

  • Achieve ≥4.3/5 onboarding satisfaction score via participant surveys.

  • Reduce average ramp time to first deal or customer milestone by 15–20%.

  • Partner with Sales Managers to implement a manager onboarding guide or coaching toolkit with >75% usage in pilot groups.

  • Support one large-scale initiative (e.g., QBR redesign or Sales Kickoff content delivery) with strong stakeholder feedback.

Within 6–12 Months:

  • Deliver at least two ongoing learning programs (e.g., methodology refresh, objection handling, cross-sell motion) with 80%+ rep engagement.

  • Improve tool adoption (Gong comments, LMS course completions, Guru views) by 20%+ across the EMEA region.

  • Drive measurable improvement in one key GTM metric (e.g., win rate uplift, stage conversion, CSAT) tied to enablement programs.

  • Contribute to quarterly enablement dashboards and retrospectives that clearly tie programming to business outcomes.

  • Maintain stakeholder satisfaction ≥8.5/10 from Sales and CS leaders via pulse surveys or feedback forums.

About You

  • 3+ years in sales, enablement, or training roles, with a proven ability to drive measurable commercial impact.

  • Deep understanding of B2B sales processes and methodologies (e.g., Command of the Message, MEDDPICC).

  • Experience launching enablement programs in fast-paced, high-growth tech environments.

  • Strong facilitation and instructional design skills across virtual, hybrid, and live formats.

  • Excellent project management and communication skills; you know how to get things done without chaos.

  • Tech-savvy: familiar with enablement tools like Gong, Salesforce, Guru, LMS platforms.

  • Passion for learning, iterating, and making things better—always.

How we hire

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 7 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days and 2 company-wide wellbeing days and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Gympass and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - one to two days a week in the London office and the opportunity to work abroad 45 days a year

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We’re an equal opportunities employer. And proud of it. Every applicant and employee is afforded the same opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. This will never change. Read our Equality, Diversity & Inclusion policy here.

Right to Work

Do you have the right to work in the UK? Unfortunately, at this time we cannot offer sponsorship for this role and we cannot consider overseas applications.

Safeguarding

All posts in Multiverse involve some degree of responsibility for safeguarding. Successful applicants are required to complete a Disclosure Form from the Disclosure and Barring Service ("DBS") for the position. Failure to declare any convictions (that are not subject to DBS filtering) may disqualify a candidate for appointment or result in summary dismissal if the discrepancy comes to light subsequently.

jobs.title: AI Instructor
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Multiverse is the upskilling platform for AI and Tech adoption.

We have partnered with 1,500+ companies to deliver a new kind of learning that's transforming today’s workforce.

Our upskilling apprenticeships are designed for people of any age and career stage to build critical AI, data, and tech skills. Our learners have driven $2bn+ ROI for their employers, using the skills they’ve learned to improve productivity and measurable performance.

In June 2022, we announced a $220 million Series D funding round co-led by StepStone Group, Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst. With a post-money valuation of $1.7bn, the round makes us the UK’s first EdTech unicorn.

But we aren’t stopping there. With a strong operational footprint and 800+ employees, we have ambitious plans to continue scaling. We’re building a world where tech skills unlock people’s potential and output.

Join Multiverse and power our mission to equip the workforce to win in the AI era.

The Opportunity

As an instructor, you will be responsible for the delivery of our technical content across our AI for Business Value and AI-Powered Productivity Programmes. You’ll support our apprentices in growing their understanding of how AI can solve business problems through workshops and drop in sessions. You will help apprentices develop knowledge relating to the appropriate KSBs throughout their programme.

The Multiverse delivery team is a diverse mix of industry experts, educators, and academics, working together to build the future of work. You will be part of this team, reporting to a Delivery Lead who will guide your development.

To ensure a strong start, you will complete a 3-week onboarding programme, covering:

  • Modern teaching methodologies - for a hands-on, engaging learning experience

  • Technical upskilling - to align with the relevant apprenticeship standard

  • Practical coaching opportunities - a rigorous, robust feedback process to get you ready to launch your programme

At the end of onboarding, you will be ready to support Multiverse apprentices, helping them develop technical expertise and industry-relevant skills relating to AI and Data domains and drive impact within their businesses. We believe this is an opportunity like no other!

Specifically, you will:

  • Confidently facilitate delivery sessions of our technical Learning content, ensuring the session delivers against learning objectives within the allotted time.

  • Adhere to the Coach Quality framework to ensure a consistent level of quality for every session and a consistent experience for every apprentice.

  • Create a vibrant, inclusive and motivating environment that drives apprentice learning, engagement and overall satisfaction.

  • Moderate assignments in line with mark schemes to ensure quality and consistency while providing feedback and feed forward for apprentices to continually develop their technical and durable skills.

  • Maintain an owners mentality, whether assigned a learner or in support of other coaches, being proactive in taking action, sharing feedback, or providing support to ensure the progress and success of learners.

  • Regularly liaise with coaches to align on apprentice interventions to ensure successful completion of programme.

  • Coordinate with cohort coaches and operations members to align on apprentice development and progress

  • Utilise resources & learning opportunities provided by Multiverse, stay up-to-date on knowledge, learning and product updates, to ensure you are equipped to support your apprentices.

  • Build & maintain credibility with your apprentices by utilising a mixture of professional experience, program/domain/industry knowledge and client context in your interactions.

  • Create a compelling narrative about Multiverse, our mission and the pillars of our offering. Help apprentices connect to it through the duration of their apprenticeship and beyond.

About you:

  • You possess strong written and on-camera communication and presentation skills.

  • You can skillfully adjust communication approaches to explain complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • You can think critically and solve problems as they arise, especially in an online classroom setting.

  • You are committed to continuous professional development and staying current with industry trends.

  • You have industry experience of applying AI to create ROI in a business context.

  • You are a seasoned professional with a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience; ideally in AI, Software Development or Business Analysis roles.

  • You are deeply interested in generative AI and regularly use tools to improve your own productivity.

  • You excel at explaining technical concepts clearly and compellingly to diverse audiences.

  • You have exceptional written and on-camera communication and facilitation skills, with proven ability to engage business audiences, including leaders.

  • You are passionate about developing others' skills and strongly align with Multiverse's mission to create equitable access to economic opportunity.

Desirable:

  • Prior experience delivering formal training or coaching, particularly on AI, data or digital transformation topics.

  • Deep familiarity or certifications related to specific AI tools like Microsoft 365 Copilot, Gemini for Google Workspace or Microsoft Copilot Studio.

  • Experience in curriculum development or instructional design.

  • A postgraduate qualification (e.g., Master's degree) in a related field (AI, Data Science, CS, Digital Transformation).

  • Experience with programming, digital transformation or creating machine learning models.

  • You also align closely with our values and can share examples of how you have demonstrated them.

This is a full time, permanent opportunity to join the Multiverse team.

How we hire

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 7 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days and 4 company-wide wellbeing days and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Gympass and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid & remote work offering - with monthly visits to the London office and the opportunity to work abroad 10 days a year

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We’re an equal opportunities employer. And proud of it. Every applicant and employee is afforded the same opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. This will never change. Read our Equality, Diversity & Inclusion policy here.

Right to Work

Do you have the right to work in the UK? Unfortunately, at this time we cannot offer sponsorship for this role and we cannot consider overseas applications.

Safeguarding

All posts in Multiverse involve some degree of responsibility for safeguarding. Successful applicants are required to complete a Disclosure Form from the Disclosure and Barring Service ("DBS") for the position. Failure to declare any convictions (that are not subject to DBS filtering) may disqualify a candidate for appointment or result in summary dismissal if the discrepancy comes to light subsequently.

jobs.title: AI Automation Builder (No-Code) (Contract)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Multiverse is the upskilling platform for AI and Tech adoption.

We have partnered with 1,500+ companies to deliver a new kind of learning that's transforming today’s workforce.

Our upskilling apprenticeships are designed for people of any age and career stage to build critical AI, data, and tech skills. Our learners have driven $2bn+ ROI for their employers, using the skills they’ve learned to improve productivity and measurable performance.

In June 2022, we announced a $220 million Series D funding round co-led by StepStone Group, Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst. With a post-money valuation of $1.7bn, the round makes us the UK’s first EdTech unicorn.

But we aren’t stopping there. With a strong operational footprint and 800+ employees, we have ambitious plans to continue scaling. We’re building a world where tech skills unlock people’s potential and output.

Join Multiverse and power our mission to equip the workforce to win in the AI era.

At Multiverse, we’ve built a new model for transforming today’s workforce by combining expert human coaching with AI. We’re on a mission to equip workers with the skills they need to win in the AI era.

As part of our AI Transformation team and play a key role in executing our strategic vision to become an AI-first organization in our daily operations.

Your primary responsibility will be to coordinate and deliver high-impact initiatives, deploying automations and AI agents across key workflows. This role is ideal for a highly effective builder who thrives in fast-paced environments and can drive change through influence, project delivery, and speed to execution, ultimately enabling our team to better serve our learners and clients.

This is an individual contributor role reporting into the Head of AI Transformation You’ll work alongside a team of 2 AI Transformation Leads with a specific focus on our Operations organization.

Core Responsibilities

  • Every three weeks, you’ll be briefed on a new fully-scoped sprint to build an automation or agent that utilises AI tools. You’ll translate the commercial sprint brief into technical next steps.

  • Select the best no-code/low-code platforms, connectors, and authentication methods for the job, subject to those available within our authorised tech stack.

  • Build and iterate on automations in a non-production environment before migrating to production.

  • Integrate and leverage LLMs via APIs to perform complex tasks within the automated workflows.

  • Implement our naming, versioning, and logging standards to ensure proper governance.

  • Validate GDPR and data-security requirements with our InfoSec partner.

  • Run a 60-minute enablement session for stakeholders.

  • Document ROI assumptions and identify potential next steps for future projects.

Essential Skills & Experience

  • A track record of shipping multi-step automations in a SaaS environment using no-code platforms (e.g., Zapier, Make, n8n).

  • A solid grasp of REST APIs, webhooks, and JSON payloads.

  • Advanced prompt engineering skills for getting reliable, structured outputs from LLMs.

  • Experience integrating various AI models and tools into automated workflows.

  • Strong stakeholder communication and rapid requirements gathering.

  • Exceptional organizational and time management skills, with a proven ability to manage multiple priorities and adapt to a fast-paced environment with shifting goals.

  • Strong analytical skills with experience handling and interpreting data to measure the impact of automation initiatives.

  • Resilience and a growth mindset, with the ability to navigate challenges and learn quickly.

Key Outcomes (per 3-week sprint)

  • Process Mapping - For a given project, capture the trigger-action flow, confirm data fields, and define success metrics for an AI-enhanced workflow.

  • AI Automation Build - Deliver a robust, multi-step automation using platforms like Zapier, n8n, or others. This will include error handling, branching logic, and the integration of LLMs for tasks like data extraction, summarization, and content generation.

  • Testing & Hardening - Run end-to-end tests, set up retry policies, and pipe alerts to Slack to ensure reliability.

  • Governance - Work in partnership with an AI Transformation Lead to ensure all work is compliant with internal data, legal and product policies.

  • Handover - Create a concise runbook, record a Loom walkthrough and brief an internal "Process Owner" for future maintenance.

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with a wide variety of no-code/low-code automation tools.

  • Familiarity with process mapping and analysis techniques.

  • Experience working in a high-growth environment.

  • Experience working in EdTech, executive education or corporate training.

Right to Work

Do you have the right to work in the UK? Unfortunately, at this time we cannot offer sponsorship for this role and we cannot consider overseas applications.

This is a contract role with an expected duration of 3 months, with potential extension.

You will be instrumental in enabling Multiverse to achieve its ambitious growth goals and, in turn, help shape the future of work.

This is a leadership role that blends deep technical expertise with strategic business partnership. You will lead a talented GTM systems team, partner with senior leadership across the company, and guide the technology roadmap that will fuel the next chapter of our global expansion.

What You’ll Do

  • Strategic Vision & Operational Execution: Develop and lead the long-term strategic vision for the GTM tech stack, while also overseeing its tactical and operational execution. You will build the strategy and roadmap that balances ambitious, future-focused projects with the iterative enhancements needed to support the business day-to-day.

  • Team Leadership & Development: Lead, mentor, and grow a high-performing GTM Systems team. You will be deeply invested in your team's growth, creating pathways for them to develop both their technical skills and their strategic and collaborative soft skills, thereby creating new opportunities for their careers.

  • Drive Innovation & Continuous Improvement: Drive a culture of innovation by constantly seeking out new technologies and methodologies. You will find new ways to tackle problems, look for ways to optimize and improve, and enhance operational efficiency across the GTM organization. AI is at the core of our mission, our company, GTM as a whole, and this role in particular.

  • Systems Architecture & Scalability: Oversee the architecture, security, and performance of our core GTM platforms. This includes our Salesforce instance (Sales Cloud & Marketing Cloud), our integrated intelligence and engagement stack (Gong, Lusha, Cognism), our internal knowledge and productivity tools (e.g. Guru, Sana, Coda, Slack, Zapier), and emerging AI platforms like Gemini and Cassidy.

  • Foster a Culture of Operational Excellence: Foster operational excellence in everything you do, from solution design and development to data governance and user support. You will establish and guide the adoption of best practices to ensure our systems are reliable, scalable, and drive measurable business impact.

  • Executive Partnership: Act as the primary business partner to senior leaders in Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Data & Insights, Product, and Finance. Translate business strategy and requirements into elegant, scalable, and future-proof systems-based solutions.

About you

  • Experience: 8+ years of experience in GTM Systems, Business Systems, or Revenue Operations, with at least 4 years in a people leadership role. Proven success in a fast-paced, high-growth B2B SaaS environment is essential.

  • Strategic & Operational Balance: You possess a unique ability to balance long-term strategic vision with meticulous operational execution. You can build a multi-year plan while ensuring short-term projects are followed through on and delivered with excellence.

  • Leadership Style: You are an inspirational leader and a true "player-coach" invested in the growth of your team. You are passionate about developing people's hard and soft skills to unlock their full potential. You have a proactive and curious approach to problem-solving, always looking for ways to improve and innovate.

  • Technical Acumen: Deep architectural expertise in the Salesforce platform (verified through relevant certifications). You have a strong command of the broader GTM technology landscape and have experience managing an integrated stack that includes tools like Gong, Lusha, Cognism, Guru, Sana, Zapier, Coda, Slack, and emerging AI platforms.

  • Mission Alignment: You are passionate about social and economic mobility and are motivated by Multiverse's mission to provide equitable access to career opportunities.

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 5 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days, 2 company-wide wellbeing days (M-Powered Weekend) and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Wellhub and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - we collaborate in the office 3 days per week

  • Work-from-anywhere scheme - you'll have the opportunity to work from anywhere, up to 10 days per year

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

 - Strong problem-solving skills and a willingness to take initiative and learn from feedback.

 - Effective communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to engage with technical and non-technical colleagues.

Whether you're experienced in operations, instruction and delivery, or unsure about where you could fit, we want to hear from you.

The Opportunity

As a Data Cohort Coach  you will be responsible for guiding the learning experience for apprentices  and helping them reach their full potential. Your role will be focusing on personalised coaching, where you'll be supporting apprentices across multiple businesses to become the next generation of business leaders.

Specifically, you will

  • Guide apprentices to successful, timely completion of their programme.

  • Master group and individualised coaching techniques to enhance apprentice learning.

  • Adhere  to coach quality frameworks to ensure a consistent level of quality for every coaching session and a consistent experience for every apprentice.

  • Create a vibrant, inclusive and motivating environment that drives apprentice learning, engagement and overall satisfaction.

  • Maintain an owner’s mentality, whether while working with assigned apprentices or in support of other coaches, be proactive in taking action, sharing feedback, or providing support to ensure the progress and success of our learners.

  • Work with Ops and other supporting teams to review and action the data provided to deliver the best experience for your apprentices.

  • Engage with apprentice managers for synchronous progress reviews using the information provided by the ops teams.

  • Focus on results related to the programme health of your apprentices, implementing interventions in partnership with operations team members to ensure learners stay on track, standing the best chance of success on programmes.

  • Utilize resources & learning opportunities provided by Multiverse, stay up-to-date on knowledge, learning and product updates, to ensure you are equipped to support your apprentices.

  • Build & maintain credibility with your apprentices by utilising a mixture of professional experience, program/domain knowledge and client context in your interactions.

  • Create a compelling narrative about Multiverse, our mission, and the pillars of our offering, and help apprentices connect to it through the duration of their apprenticeship, and beyond.

About you

Technical Capability

  • 3 + years of professional experience where you have used data on a daily basis to make informed business decisions

  • Strong expertise in data collection, processing, and analysis, with proficiency in Excel and BI tools.

Teaching & Coaching Capability

  • Exceptional written, verbal and on-camera communication and presentation skills

  • Practical experience teaching, mentoring or coaching professionals in an academic or commercial environment

  • Demonstrated mastery of coaching best practices and/or openness to develop in this area

  • Passion for delivering the best learning opportunities and supporting others on their development journey

  • Experience managing and developing positive stakeholder relationships; as a coach, part of your role will be working closely with both learners and their managers

  • Belief in the principles of applied learning: supporting learners to develop the knowledge, skills and behaviors to generate real business outcomes as quickly as possible

How we hire

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 7 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days and 4 company-wide wellbeing days and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Gympass and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - monthly visits to the London office and the opportunity to work abroad 45 days a year

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We’re an equal opportunities employer. And proud of it. Every applicant and employee is afforded the same opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. This will never change. Read our Equality, Diversity & Inclusion policy here.

Right to Work

Do you have the right to work in the UK? Unfortunately, at this time we cannot offer sponsorship for this role and we cannot consider overseas applications.

Safeguarding

All posts in Multiverse involve some degree of responsibility for safeguarding. Successful applicants are required to complete a Disclosure Form from the Disclosure and Barring Service ("DBS") for the position. Failure to declare any convictions (that are not subject to DBS filtering) may disqualify a candidate for appointment or result in summary dismissal if the discrepancy comes to light subsequently.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Multiverse is the upskilling platform for AI and Tech adoption.

We have partnered with 1,500+ companies to deliver a new kind of learning that's transforming today’s workforce.

Our upskilling apprenticeships are designed for people of any age and career stage to build critical AI, data, and tech skills. Our learners have driven $2bn+ ROI for their employers, using the skills they’ve learned to improve productivity and measurable performance.

In June 2022, we announced a $220 million Series D funding round co-led by StepStone Group, Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst. With a post-money valuation of $1.7bn, the round makes us the UK’s first EdTech unicorn.

But we aren’t stopping there. With a strong operational footprint and 800+ employees, we have ambitious plans to continue scaling. We’re building a world where tech skills unlock people’s potential and output.

Join Multiverse and power our mission to equip the workforce to win in the AI era.

Having built a thriving upskilling apprenticeship business we are now doubling down on our AI strategy with the launch of a groundbreaking AI Adoption Platform. This new venture operates as a ‘startup’ within the business, leveraging Multiverse's established customer base, intellectual property, and experienced team. Our MVP has already demonstrated 7x adoption results in initial pilots by delivering personalized, role- and tool-specific AI use cases and upskilling at scale, enhanced by social features and measurable ROI. We are building a dedicated team to rapidly develop and scale this platform, and we're looking for pioneering individuals to drive its market success from the ground up.

This is a rare opportunity to:

  • Develop a category-defining product with proven initial traction into a greenfield UK market

  • Solve a massive enterprise pain point that affects every major global company

  • Build something from scratch while leveraging proven playbooks and IP

  • Shape the future of work in the AI era.

About the Role

We are building a small foundational team of engineers to build and iterate on our new adoption platform. You’ll be working closely together with our AI Adoption Team to build new features from scratch, quickly iterating to improve them as we get customer feedback and continue to evolve our offer.

This is a fast paced, scrappy and highly collaborative team, working to solve complex and compelling engineering challenges. We’ll provide you with the support, autonomy, and flexibility you need to do your best work. We believe in creating an environment where everyone can thrive and grow, supported by mentorship, learning opportunities, and a strong team culture.

You’ll Succeed in This Role If You:

  • Care deeply about software engineering and want to continuously develop your craft

  • You thrive in ambiguity and with open-ended briefs

  • Are passionate about the 0 to 1 stage of product development

  • Enjoy working collaboratively and helping others succeed

  • Work effectively in partnership with peers and stakeholders to make decisions

  • Are adaptable and curious about learning new tools, frameworks, and technologies

  • Are excited about exploring the potential of AI-assisted development (e.g., tools like Cursor or Gemini) to enhance quality and velocity

About You:

  • Experience working in cross-functional product teams (typically 5+ years, but we welcome strong candidates with equivalent experience)

  • Ability to design, develop, and maintain new products from scratch

  • Excited about working on greenfield projects

  • Comfortable choosing the right tools for the job—our stack includes Python, TypeScript, React, Elixir, AWS

  • Skilled at working across the development lifecycle—from requirements to deployment and ongoing support

  • Collaborative, with experience mentoring or supporting other team members


Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 5 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days, 2 company-wide wellbeing days (M-Powered Weekend) and 8 bank holidays per year.

  • Health & Wellness - private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Wellhub and access to Spill - all in one mental health support.

  • Hybrid work offering - we collaborate in the London office 3 days per week.

  • Work-from-anywhere scheme - you'll have the opportunity to work from anywhere, up to 10 days per year.

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

About Multiverse

At Multiverse we equip the workforce to win in the AI era. We achieve this through a powerful blend of software and services, delivering essential AI, tech, and data skills at scale. This translates into tangible value for employers – we’ve tracked over $2 billion in ROI to date through improvements in productivity and performance.

Over ¼ of the FTSE 500 trusts Multiverse to transform their workforce, with our customers including John Lewis, Barclays, and the NHS. This success is amplified by strategic alliances with industry leaders such as Microsoft, Salesforce, and Databricks. Our approach has fuelled exceptional growth; a winner of the Sunday Time's Fast Growing Tech companies, we’ve more than doubled revenue over the last two years.

Multiverse is backed by some of Silicon Valley's most prestigious investors, including General Catalyst, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Index Ventures, with luminaries like Mary Meeker and Martha Lane Fox on our board.

As we intensify our focus on AI, both internally and for our customers, we're guided by an exceptional AI advisory board including Professor Mehran Sahami (Chair of Computer Science, Stanford University) and Professor Michael Wooldridge (Ashall Professor of Foundations of Artificial Intelligence, Oxford University).

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

You’ll also play a key role in defining what the end-to-end user experience of the product is, and how it’s positioned in the market, influence strategic decisions through design

  • Lead concept sprints and align stakeholders through storytelling

  • Design and iterate on flows, prototypes, and high-quality visuals for AI-enabled features

  • Identify opportunities for AI to improve adoption and engagement

  • Ensure a consistent, high-quality experience across the product

  • Balance speed with craft - moving fast without sacrificing usability

What You Bring (Capabilities)

  • 8+ years designing UX and UI for software (bonus if with AI or ML-driven products)

Specifically, you will

  • Create a vibrant, inclusive and motivating environment that drives apprentice learning, engagement and overall satisfaction.

  • Maintain an owner’s mentality, whether while working with assigned apprentices or in support of other coaches, be proactive in taking action, sharing feedback, or providing support to ensure the progress and success of our learners.

  • Work with Ops and other supporting teams to review and action the data provided to deliver the best experience for your apprentices.

  • Engage with apprentice managers for synchronous progress reviews using the information provided by the ops teams.

  • Focus on results related to the programme health of your apprentices, implementing interventions in partnership with operations team members to ensure learners stay on track, standing the best chance of success on programmes.

  • Utilize resources & learning opportunities provided by Multiverse, stay up-to-date on knowledge, learning and product updates, to ensure you are equipped to support your apprentices.

  • Build & maintain credibility with your apprentices by utilising a mixture of professional experience, program/domain knowledge and client context in your interactions.

  • Create a compelling narrative about Multiverse, our mission, and the pillars of our offering, and help apprentices connect to it through the duration of their apprenticeship, and beyond.

About you

Technical Capability

  • 3 + years of professional experience where you have used data on a daily basis to make informed business decisions

  • Solid proficiency in the latest generative AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini)

Teaching & Coaching Capability

  • Exceptional written, verbal and on-camera communication and presentation skills

  • Practical experience teaching, mentoring or coaching professionals in an academic or commercial environment

  • Demonstrated mastery of coaching best practices and/or openness to develop in this area

  • Passion for delivering the best learning opportunities and supporting others on their development journey

  • Experience managing and developing positive stakeholder relationships; as a coach, part of your role will be working closely with both learners and their managers

  • Belief in the principles of applied learning: supporting learners to develop the knowledge, skills and behaviors to generate real business outcomes as quickly as possible

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Gympass and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - monthly visits to the London office and the opportunity to work abroad 45 days a year

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

jobs.title: External Examiner
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Multiverse is the upskilling platform for AI and Tech adoption.

We have partnered with 1,500+ companies to deliver a new kind of learning that's transforming today’s workforce.

Our upskilling apprenticeships are designed for people of any age and career stage to build critical AI, data, and tech skills. Our learners have driven $2bn+ ROI for their employers, using the skills they’ve learned to improve productivity and measurable performance.

In June 2022, we announced a $220 million Series D funding round co-led by StepStone Group, Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst. With a post-money valuation of $1.7bn, the round makes us the UK’s first EdTech unicorn.

But we aren’t stopping there. With a strong operational footprint and 800+ employees, we have ambitious plans to continue scaling. We’re building a world where tech skills unlock people’s potential and output.

Join Multiverse and power our mission to equip the workforce to win in the AI era.

Role Overview

We are seeking to appoint an External Examiner to oversee the provision of our higher education accredited programs, which specialise in Data Analytics, Technology Consulting, and Software Engineering. Apprentices completing our degree programmes get awarded with a degree in BSc Digital Technology and Solutions.

The External Examiner will perform a dual function: confirming academic standards for the degree qualification and providing External Quality Assurance for the End-Point Assessment (EPA). Your role will be to ensure that national higher education standards have been achieved and upheld by Multiverse.

Key Responsibilities

As an External Examiner for the degree and an External Assessor for the End-Point Assessment (EPA), you will hold a crucial dual role. You are responsible for confirming that the academic standards of the overall award meet sector-recognised standards, while also ensuring the quality and integrity of the EPA. You will provide an informed, independent view on how Multiverse’s standards compare with similar awards and assessments at other providers based on your wealth of professional experience.

Your duties will include:

Pre-Assessment Duties

  • Assessment Design and Approval: You will review, provide expert feedback on, and formally approve the design of our summative assessments before they are issued to apprentices. This includes:

    • Scrutinising assignment briefs and examination papers for the degree qualification.

    • Reviewing the assessment instruments and materials for the End-Point Assessment (EPA).

Post-Assessment Duties

  • External Moderation: You will externally moderate apprentice results by reviewing a sample of completed, marked and internally moderated assessments. The purpose is to confirm that marking criteria have been applied fairly, accurately, and consistently.

  • Observation of Live Assessment (EPA): For the EPA, you will also observe live assessments (e.g., presentations, practical tasks) to ensure assessors are upholding national standards in practice.

Overarching Responsibilities

  • External Quality Assurance for EPA: You will review EPA documentation and materials, and attend EPA Standardisation Meetings to ensure assessors are applying assessment criteria correctly and upholding national standards.

  • Board of Examiners: You will attend and contribute to relevant Board of Examiners meetings in which decisions are being made about granting credits, approving progressions and awards. You will typically attend eight Board of Examiners meetings a year.

  • Reporting: You will be prompted to submit an Annual Report on apprentice performance and academic standards, as well as on the effectiveness of our assessments. This report will include any lessons to be drawn and actions to be taken. You will also report confidentially to the Director of Advanced Programmes on any matters of serious concern.

  • Stakeholder Engagement: You will conduct at least one visit per cohort (virtual or in-person) to engage with assessors, staff, apprentices, and employers to gain a holistic view of assessment quality.

Cadence and Logistics

  • Boards of Examiners: Multiverse operates on a quarterly enrollment schedule, which means we have eight Boards of Examiners per year. There will be two per quarter: one to confirm credits for general modules and progress learners from one level to the next, and one to gateway and/or award apprentices. You will be expected to attend these meetings remotely.

  • Workload: Each Board of Examiners meeting will cover multiple modules and cohorts. An additional External Examiner will be appointed once you reach 10 modules or 200 scripts to moderate, whichever threshold is met first.

Programme Specific Information:

External Examiners are required for our degree programmes, resulting in a BSc Digital and Technology Solutions Professional (Digital Transformation), BSc Digital and Technology Solutions Professional (Data Analyst), and BSc Hons Digital and Technology Solutions (Software Engineering). These are apprenticeship programmes with all participating apprentices in full-time roles. Multiverse’s approach to blended work-based learning ensures consistent and deliberate alignment between the knowledge learners are acquiring and the skills they are practising on a day-to-day basis in their role.

Programme summary:

  • Stage 1 (Level 5): Foundational and Advanced Application: This stage begins by establishing the fundamentals of the DTSP standard, developing learners into junior professionals. It then broadens their technical knowledge by introducing more complex skills and practices. Learners will synthesise concepts, evaluate how they inform day-to-day work, and apply their learning to solve increasingly complex problems.

  • Stage 2 (Level 6): Professional Mastery and Specialisation: In the final stage, learners deepen the expertise acquired at Level 5 to independently and confidently apply their knowledge across a range of situations. The programme culminates in a final, large-scale digital transformation project that will showcase their comprehensive learning and skills from across the entire programme.

A more in-depth programme specification will be provided to successful applicants.

Compensation

Your compensation will be provided on a per-task basis:

  • Induction: £200

  • Board of Examiners: £250 (up to 100 scripts moderated)

  • EPA Standardisation Meetings: £250

  • Additional Scripts: £75 for each additional script up to 50 scripts moderated

  • Assessment Approval: £125 per approval of assessment

  • Annual Report: £200

Key Skills and Characteristics

We are looking for someone with:

  • Significant academic experience in Higher Education.

  • Previous External Examiner experience.

  • Program-specific subject matter expertise.

  • A preferred understanding of apprenticeships.

  • A passion for applied learning.

  • A flexible disposition, comfortable with non-traditional processes.

  • A high degree of knowledge and good understanding of the UK Higher Education sector and appropriate sector reference points;

  • An understanding of academic standards and quality assurance processes in higher education institutions.

  • Understanding of the principles of applied learning in higher education;

  • Experience of course design and assessment at the level we are seeking;

  • Experience of assessment procedures, particularly innovative forms of assessment which are focused on applied learning;

  • Understanding of the specific programme provision and how it is different from other forms of higher education

  • Standing, credibility and breadth of experience within the subject area

Application Process

To apply, please submit a Cover Letter and CV.

This should include the following information:

  • Academic Qualifications;

  • Any professional body membership;

  • Teaching experience;

  • Curriculum development;

  • Prior experience as External Examiner;

  • Academic Publications.

At Multiverse, we’re building a product-led business that transforms the workplace through high-quality apprenticeships, giving people from all backgrounds access to world-class careers.

Our UX team designs intuitive, inclusive, insight-driven experiences that drive real outcomes — with velocity, learning, and craft excellence at the core.

We’re seeking a strategic, hands-on Senior Product Design Manager to elevate UX quality and effectiveness across a pivotal product group: Product Fundamentals. You'll help deliver against our “Cost to Serve” OKR, building smarter systems that reduce operational effort without compromising user experience.

What You'll Do

  • Shape UX vision and priorities across your group: Align 3–4 cross-functional squads around user-centred goals, driving quality, efficiency, and measurable impact.

  • Be a hands-on leader (Player-Coach): As a Player, you'll spend around 40% of your time actively contributing to strategic discovery, vision prototyping, and unblocking squad work. As a Coach, you'll spend around 60% of your time developing your team — growing skillsets, managing performance, and raising the UX quality bar.. You'll lead from both the pitch and the sidelines, flexing your hands-on involvement based on team needs and maturity.

  • Champion quality and growth: Embed critique culture, QA standards, and operational UX excellence across your squads.

  • Drive scalable, cost-efficient systems: Design smart solutions that reduce internal effort and increase user satisfaction.

  • Collaborate across disciplines: Work closely with Research, Data, Product, and Engineering partners.

  • Embed Growth Design practices: Help your team prioritise experiments, optimisation, and measurable improvements.

  • Evolve our design operations: Shape planning rituals and workflows that support fast, sustainable delivery.

  • Hire, lead, and develop your team: Manage 2–5 product designers, building a culture of high performance and creativity.

About You

  • Proven experience leading design teams and scaling quality in fast-paced environments.

  • Strong UX craft and systems thinking, with a portfolio showing real-world impact.

  • Skilled at balancing strategic leadership and hands-on contribution.

  • Collaborative by nature — building strong partnerships across Product, Engineering, and Data.

  • Comfortable embedding Growth Design principles and experimentation mindsets.

  • A strong coach who grows designers’ craft, confidence, and impact.

  • Fluent in Figma and fast at using prototyping for communication and alignment.

  • Embodying Multiverse values, especially "Development is at our core."

Bonus Points

While not required, you might stand out even more if you:

  • Show proof of curiosity through side projects — experimenting with things like 'vibe coding', new AI tools, or self-driven UX challenges.

  • Bring multidimensional experience across complementary areas like coding, copywriting, motion design, video editing, or growth marketing.

  • Can obsess over specific problems, going deep to truly understand the nuances of a user need or system challenge.

Who You’ll Be Joining

You’ll join a thoughtful, ambitious team of designers and researchers shaping Multiverse’s product evolution.

  • Designers work as true partners with PMs and Engineers.

  • Strong foundations exist: Product First Principles, Design QA, Critique Culture, and a Design System — with varied adoption across squads.

  • Based on the Nielsen Norman UX Maturity Model, we’re currently at Stage 4: Structured — systematic, but variably effective.

  • We're evolving toward a more craft-driven, scalable UX culture, and you’ll play a key role in raising maturity and consistency.

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 7 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days and 2 company-wide wellbeing days and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Gympass and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - and the opportunity to take part in our work-from-anywhere scheme

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We’re an equal opportunities employer. And proud of it. Every applicant and employee is afforded the same opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. The Opportunity

We’re looking for a visionary ‘Product Designer - AI Creator’. A hybrid blend of product designer, AI-enabled prototyper, and design systems thinker. You’ll own and scale Stardust, our AI-native, brand-led design system, while also:

  • Creating AI workflows that enable faster, smarter product creation.

  • Bringing our brand refresh into product, marketing, and launch moments.

  • Defining a motion language that makes our product feel alive and dynamic.

  • Influencing interaction patterns and components to deliver a frictionless, accessible UX.

  • Partnering with PMM to tell compelling product stories in video and motion.

This is a pioneering, first-of-its-kind multi-disciplinary role - you’ll be one of the first AI Creators at Multiverse. Agentic means design systems built for AI collaboration, so agents can generate, assemble, and refine UI using structured prompts and our in-house MCP AI brain, not just human input.

An ‘AI Creator’ is a role that uses AI agents to unlock full-stack product creation in a blended role. You’ll reimagine how traditional roles evolve in the AI era, sharing responsibility for product management, roadmaps, metrics, and stakeholder comms. You’ll work with AI tools that take care of repetitive tasks, freeing you to focus on creativity, craft, storytelling, and taste leadership. You’re not just designing components, you’re re-defining how human creativity, brand, accessibility, and AI collaborate to make our product more dynamic, alive, and frictionless.

What You’ll Do

  • Design interfaces that elevate brand, accessibility, and emotional impact.

  • Scale Stardust into a complete, consistent component library with full-page layouts and interaction patterns.

  • Extend the design system to include motion and AI-specific interaction patterns.

  • Prototype internal design workflows using AI tools, metadata, and creative automation.

  • Build our first in-house Design System MCP to enable prompt-able brand guidelines and UI flows.

  • Lead end-to-end design from discovery through to polished execution.

  • Apply the refreshed brand across in-product and marketing surfaces.

  • Share stories, demos, and updates to inspire adoption.

About You

  • 8+ years designing UX and UI for software (bonus: AI or ML-driven products).

  • Systems thinker with a passion for and experience scaling at least two design systems.

  • Strong craft in UI, motion, video, and brand expression (Lottie, AE, Final Cut, Capsule, Rive etc)

  • Experience in rapid prototyping (Figma, Framer, Webflow, Replit, Lovebale etc.).

  • Curious and proactive in experimenting with AI tools (Gemini, Claude, Cursor, Midjourney, GPT).

  • Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.

  • Comfortable shaping problems into clear, actionable goals.

What Success Looks Like (6–12 months)

  • Brand refresh embedded in motion-rich, accessible product experiences.

  • MVP of Design System MCP launched and adopted.

  • 80%+ design system adoption across the tech org.

  • Faster prototyping and shipping cycles.

  • Strong stakeholder trust through clear updates and measurable impact.

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 7 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days and 2 company-wide wellbeing days and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Gympass and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - and the opportunity to take part in our work-from-anywhere scheme

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Multiverse is the upskilling platform for AI and Tech adoption.

We have partnered with 1,500+ companies to deliver a new kind of learning that's transforming today’s workforce.

Our upskilling apprenticeships are designed for people of any age and career stage to build critical AI, data, and tech skills. Our learners have driven $2bn+ ROI for their employers, using the skills they’ve learned to improve productivity and measurable performance.

In June 2022, we announced a $220 million Series D funding round co-led by StepStone Group, Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst. With a post-money valuation of $1.7bn, the round makes us the UK’s first EdTech unicorn.

But we aren’t stopping there. With a strong operational footprint and 800+ employees, we have ambitious plans to continue scaling. We’re building a world where tech skills unlock people’s potential and output.

Join Multiverse and power our mission to equip the workforce to win in the AI era.

We believe the best user experiences happen when exceptional design and engineering push each other forward. We’re looking for a Front End Engineer to focus on our Design System to help us scale best-in-class UX to almost half a million learners.

Design engineering is a spectrum—we welcome design-minded engineers and code-curious designers. You’ll work on our design system and other foundational frontend initiatives, with the freedom to explore how new technologies (AI, agentic tools) can transform the way we build.

The Opportunity

You’ll join a multidisciplinary team spanning brand, product design, and engineering. Our immediate focus: strengthening and evolving Multiverse’s design system so our suite of applications is consistent, accessible, and performant at scale.

Beyond that, you’ll explore how agentic workflows and AI-powered tooling can unlock new ways of working—helping teams prototype, experiment, and roll out changes across applications in minutes, not days. You’ll shape how design and engineering collaborate, and help prove out the next generation of design engineering at Multiverse.

But wait, what do we mean by “agentic design system”?

  • We want to enhance our design system to a stage where changes can be made across our suite of applications in minutes, not days.

  • We want to empower product and design to prototype and experiment without sacrificing quality through vibe-coded interfaces.

  • We want to give our developers and designers best-in-class tooling so they can focus on building quality products for users.

  • We see agentic tooling as an unlock to enable new workflows and developer experience in all of these areas. This team will define and prove out this new way of working.

Specifically You Will

  • Build, evolve, and maintain our design system (React, TypeScript, Tailwind)

  • Ensure our components are accessible, performant, and tested to production standards (observability, accessibility, responsive quality)

  • Partner closely with designers to bring Figma concepts to production with high fidelity

  • Collaborate with engineers to deliver best-in-class developer experience

  • Prototype and test new workflows that leverage AI and agentic tools

  • Mentor engineers and designers across the org to elevate front-end craft and adoption of scalable systems

  • Contribute to our vision: enabling product and design to ship high-quality experiences faster, with less friction

About You

  • 5+ years in design or frontend engineering roles, delivering production-quality UIs

  • Strong in at least two of: Figma, React + TypeScript, or design system engineering (and eager to grow in the others)

  • Experience building design systems in production: accessibility, performance, and sprinkles of delight matter to you

  • Curiosity about AI-assisted workflows and how they might reshape design and development

  • Skilled collaborator and communicator across design, product, and platform teams

  • Bonus: experience building products for other designers or engineers

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 5 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days, 2 company-wide wellbeing days (M-Powered Weekend) and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Wellhub and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - we collaborate in the office 3 days per week

  • Work-from-anywhere scheme - you'll have the opportunity to work from anywhere, up to 10 days per year

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We’re an equal opportunities employer. And proud of it. Every applicant and employee is afforded the same opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. This will never change. Read our Equality, Diversity & Inclusion policy here.

Multiverse is the upskilling platform for AI and Tech adoption.

We have partnered with 1,500+ companies to deliver a new kind of learning that's transforming today’s workforce.

Our upskilling apprenticeships are designed for people of any age and career stage to build critical AI, data, and tech skills. Our learners have driven $2bn+ ROI for their employers, using the skills they’ve learned to improve productivity and measurable performance.

In June 2022, we announced a $220 million Series D funding round co-led by StepStone Group, Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst. With a post-money valuation of $1.7bn, the round makes us the UK’s first EdTech unicorn.

But we aren’t stopping there. With a strong operational footprint and 800+ employees, we have ambitious plans to continue scaling. We’re building a world where tech skills unlock people’s potential and output.

Join Multiverse and power our mission to equip the workforce to win in the AI era.


The role

As the VP of Learning Strategy & Production, you won't just manage a content roadmap; you'll be charting the course for the future of tech learning. You are a subject matter expert with deep experience in technology who is ready to lead a talented team of curriculum managers, learning designers, and subject matter experts. Your mission is to build and deliver modular, proprietary learning experiences that close the skills gaps of today and tomorrow.

This role is for a strategic leader who can oversee the entire curriculum development lifecycle, constantly pushing for innovation in our content and delivery. You'll be a key voice for Multiverse, meeting with our largest enterprise customers to share our vision, gather feedback, and help our sales team demonstrate the transformative power of our platform.

What You'll Do (Key Responsibilities):

Learning Content Strategy

  • Transform high-level business objectives into a dynamic, data-driven content strategy that sets Multiverse apart.

  • Keep your finger on the pulse of the market, researching client needs and industry trends to ensure our programs are not just relevant, but revolutionary.

  • Leverage AI to analyze market data, predict future skill gaps, and keep our content strategy one step ahead.

  • Identify and cultivate third-party content partnerships that expand our offerings and accelerate our growth.

  • Act as a key thought leader, staying informed on tech and skill development trends to ensure our product remains industry-aligned and game-changing.

AI-Powered Content Production

  • Champion the use of AI in content creation, developing best practices to generate, personalize, and quality-control our learning materials at scale.

  • Lead your team in automating content production workflows, making our processes smarter and more efficient.

  • Mentor and empower a team of instructional designers and content developers on the effective and ethical use of AI technologies to create engaging learning experiences.

  • Evaluate emerging AI technologies and drive innovation in our content production methodologies.

Client and Stakeholder Engagement

  • Be the voice and vision for our curriculum with customers and partners, building trust and excitement around our roadmap.

  • Articulate the Multiverse story with clarity and passion, motivating your team and stakeholders across the company.

  • Collaborate with Product Marketing leadership to shape the messaging and positioning of Multiverse’s learning offerings, ensuring we speak with one, powerful voice.

  • Serve as a trusted internal and external expert, providing critical support in sales conversations with our most strategic clients.

Product Evolution and Iteration

  • Partner with the technology team to prioritize features and functionality that will deliver the most effective and engaging learning programs.

  • Track and analyze internal and external metrics to continuously measure and improve the impact of our content.

  • Foster strong connections with cross-functional leaders to align on program priorities and ensure a seamless go-to-market process.

People Leadership

  • Lead, mentor, and grow a world-class team of curriculum experts, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and professional development.

  • Effectively allocate resources—including budget, personnel, and technology—to maximize your team's impact.

  • Uphold exceptionally high standards for quality, ensuring every piece of content reflects the best of Multiverse.

Who You Are (Skills and Qualifications):

Required:

  • Experience setting and executing data-driven org or company level strategies

  • Technical practitioner experience with a broad and deep expertise across multiple tech domains that could include Data, Software Engineering, Cyber Security, IT Ops, AI, or Cloud technologies.

  • A proven track record in technical education (higher education, instructor-led training, conference speaking, book publishing, and/or eLearning) with understanding of instructional design techniques and approaches at scale

  • Strong, demonstrated leadership with the ability to effectively manage remotely geographically-distributed direct reports

  • Proven expertise in a specific domain and a demonstrated fluency with the ability to rapidly research, analyze, and comprehend technical, and organization information

  • Presentation experience in front of Fortune 500 executive audiences

Preferred Skills and Qualifications:

  • Technical Certifications in one or more technical domains. (e.g. certifications from AWS, Microsoft, Google, CompTIA, etc...)

Benefits

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 7 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days and 2 company-wide wellbeing days and 8 bank holidays per year

  • Health & Wellness- private medical Insurance with Bupa, a medical cashback scheme, life insurance, gym membership & wellness resources through Wellhub and access to Spill - all in one mental health support

  • Hybrid work offering - with 3 days in our London Paddington office and the opportunity to take part in our work-from-anywhere scheme 10 days per year

  • Team fun - weekly socials, company wide events and office snacks!

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

We’re an equal opportunities employer. And proud of it. Every applicant and employee is afforded the same opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. This will never change. Read our Equality, Diversity & Inclusion policy here.

Successful applicants are required to complete a Disclosure Form from the Disclosure and Barring Service ("DBS") for the position. Failure to declare any convictions (that are not subject to DBS filtering) may disqualify a candidate for appointment or result in summary dismissal if the discrepancy comes to light subsequently.

As a Senior Software Engineer in Tech Foundation focusing on developer productivity, you’ll identify, develop, and drive improvements that boost the velocity and quality of our product teams, while enhancing the overall developer experience at Multiverse. You will have the autonomy to drive impact, ownership and innovation.

Our team builds the foundational systems engineers rely on to develop stable, scalable, and efficient services. We provide standardised infrastructure and platforms that enable teams to move fast while maintaining the flexibility to innovate.

To be successful in this role, you’ll bring a passion for improving developer experience, the ability to learn quickly, and a collaborative mindset. You will help shape internal workflows and infrastructure, identifying bottlenecks and designing scalable solutions. Your work will reduce friction, integrate AI-powered tools, and make development at Multiverse faster, more reliable, and more enjoyable.

About You

We assess candidates against our 3Cs framework: Capability, Character, and Coachability.

What we value

  • Experience designing and maintaining distributed systems. We welcome a variety of backgrounds and technology stacks.

  • Ownership of your own testing and QA, as well as deployment

  • Experience with at least one major cloud provider. We predominantly use AWS.

  • Experience in observability and monitoring practices.

  • Empathy for developer workflows and productivity.

  • Clear written and verbal communication skills.

How You’ll Contribute

Examples of the work you’ll do:

  • Improve system scalability, observability, and security to ensure platform stability.

  • Define and promote standard practices for building, operating, and observing services.

  • Build tooling to improve our platform and accelerate software development.

  • Identify pain points in engineering workflows and design both immediate fixes and long-term improvements.

  • Experiment with AI-powered automation to enhance how engineers write, test, and deploy code.

  • Collaborate with teams across Tech to solve technical challenges and design new systems.

  • Time off - 27 days holiday, plus 5 additional days off: 1 life event day, 2 volunteer days, 2 company-wide wellbeing days (M-Powered Weekend) and 8 bank holidays per year

We are just getting started, and are looking for exceptional Customer Success individuals to help drive continued growth in the UK.

  • Experience working with and influencing C-suite, C-1 and/or C-2 execs in FTSE organisations

  • Proven record of independently driving customer outcomes within complex enterprise customers in a high-touch environment

  • Proven ability to manage multiple accounts and work streams simultaneously with a high level of attention to detail
